The [How do I unlock my JIRA home directory | https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=231932719] documentation appears for JIRA 4.x but not for newer versions. 

Also, the instructions for Windows 8 are not included in the document. The instructions are very similar to Windows 7 but there are slight differences. 
* Currently the instructions tell the customer to open their windows Control Panel and click 'Appearance and Personalization'
** The control panel view may have been changed from category view, so this could be incorrect for some customers.
** In Windows 8 the name of this option has changed to "Appearance"
* Another ways that works with Windows 7 and 8: 
** Click start button and begin typing "Folder Options" (in Windows 8 a search box automatically appears

In addition to adding Windows 8, Windows Server should be added as well.
* Windows Server 2012 has same instructions as Windows 8

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42120].
  {panel}

h3. Actual Results:

When trying to link an attachment that contains {{@}} will fail to render the link.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create an issue that uses the wiki rendered for comments.
# Attach a file named with an @ symbol. Like "test@test".
# Create a comment on the issue and use the {{\[^ \]}} notation to make a link to the attachment.
# The link won't render.

h3. Expected Results: 

The user is able to link the attachment properly.

h3. Workaround:

Rename the attachment changing "@" to "at".
fields.summary: Link to attachment with @ in the filename will not render

{panel:title=Atlassian Update 23 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your comments and feedback, we really appreciate your engagement. We've made the decision to close this issue because we want to send a clear message that this is not something JIRA is going to support.

First, a few thoughts on this issue in particular.
* JIRA permission schemes are already very granular and complex. There are several dozen individual permissions that an administrator needs to understand. If these different sets of permissions were mapped at the issue type level, this would multiply the complexity.
* In our research, we already see major confusion between schemes that map configuration to issue types versus schemes that map configuration to projects.
** Issue type schemes, permissions, notifications, and issue security are all associated directly to a *project*
** Workflow schemes, field configuration schemes, and issue type screen schemes map configuration to *issue types*
* If you were to change the behavior of permission schemes so that they mapped a permission configuration to issue types, you would need to introduce a second layer – a permission configuration per issue type, and then a permission scheme to associate that set of configurations to a project.
* This is the exact opposite of the direction we want to go with JIRA. We are investing heavily in reducing complexity in JIRA administration to make it more accessible to more users.

This does not mean that the needs of JIRA admins are not important. Improving performance and simplifying project configuration are the top two priorities for the JIRA development team for the foreseeable future. However, when looking holistically at how we can improve the project configuration experience in JIRA, this request doesn't fit in to our vision.

A note on requests on jira.atlassian.com:
* We take the feedback and votes on feature requests on jira.atlassian.com seriously. Certainly the fact that there's 144 votes for this request and it's already been closed before doesn't go unnoticed.
* When we make the decision to close an issue, our goal is to make a clear statement about which features we realistically expect to support in JIRA and which features we don't expect to implement, at least not in the way they have been described in the feature request. While it might be painful or frustrating in the short term, we strongly committed to communicating our intentions as openly as possible. Everyone is better off in the long run.
* We have a detailed explanation of how we use jira.atlassian.com and how we develop our roadmap [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

We're currently in the midst of updating almost every feature request in the JRA project with a significant number of votes. Our hope is that the conclusion you draw is not that Atlassian doesn't care, but that we are trying to focus on the improvements that will the largest benefit for the most customers, and unfortunately this means that we simply cannot work on the vast majority of the hundreds of feature requests at once.

Feel free to contact me at any time if you have feedback or questions. My email address is dmeyer@atlassian.com.

Thanks,
Dave Meyer
Product Manager, JIRA
{panel}

Reopen JRA-5865 created 10 years ago. I understand the reason why you didn't implement this but there's a LOT or people and company wanting this feature. There's still a lot of activity on the issue comment.

Please reconsider implementing this feature.

Now, when a group has the permission to create an issue, it could create EVERY types of issues available. It's a complement to project specific issues types. (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1602)

For example, If we have external client (like me right now :)) I would be interrested to limit his issue creation right to only bugs, features, external client requests (custom type).

  {panel}

We were using jira.atlassian.com REST API to load some test JIRA data in our eazyBI reporting application and we were using REST API with HTTP Basic authentication (as otherwise some APIs like "user" failed with 401 Unauthorized error) and using our jira.atlassian.com username and password. At least still on January 30, 2015 it was working.

But couple days ago we discovered that simple https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/latest/serverInfo with my username and password in HTTP Basic authentication header returns 403 Forbidden response.

If I try another Atlassian JIRA site, for example, https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/rest/api/latest/serverInfo with HTTP Basic authentication then it still works.

What has changed in jira.atlassian.com authentication in recent weeks and why Basic authentication is not working anymore?
fields.summary: HTTP Basic authentication not working anymore for jira.atlassian.com REST API

The importWorklog method of DefaultJiraDataImporter makes a call to
 
worklogManager.create(userProvider.getUser(externalWorklog.getAuthor()), worklog, null, false);

The method adds worklog to issue worklog and also adds an item to the history table. The worklog item is ok:

guena logged work - 01/Sep/14 8:01 PM 

Time Spent:2 hours 
Validate

However, the corresponding history item is not ok:

guena made changes - 8 hours ago 

Time Spent  3 hours, 5 minutes [ 11100 ]  5 hours, 5 minutes [ 18300 ]  
Worklog Id  11202 [ 11202 ]  

It should be like

guena made changes  01/Sep/14 8:01 PM 

Time Spent  3 hours, 5 minutes [ 11100 ]  5 hours, 5 minutes [ 18300 ]  
Worklog Id  11202 [ 11202 ]
fields.summary: worklogManager uses current date\time instead of supplied one for history

Customer Feedback:

For certain [Workflow Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Workflow+Properties].
The name and action do not match, making it unclear on when and when not to use.
In example:
jira.permission.worklogeditall and jira.permission.worklogdeleteall 

{quote}
1)jira.issue.editable ---> disable editing action on issue. This is OK.
2)jira.permission.work.denied --> disable new log works on issue. This is OK
But
3) jira.permission.worklogeditall and jira.permission.worklogdeleteall --> by the name I expect that it should disable/enable work log editing/deleting, however these both properties deny the access to work log tab.
The property name does not match the action specified in property's name.
{quote}

Kind Regards,

Ibrahim

There is a minor bug in JIRA's "What's New" dialog which states:

"""
    1. Spend time where it counts
    
        Developers can spend time doing what they love: writing code.
        * ...
        * Up-to-date status means *less* interruptions for status updates

"""

Since "interruption" is a countable noun, the correct English grammar would be:

        * Up-to-date status means *fewer* interruptions for status updates

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 4 April 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. I’m Nathan a Product Manager at Atlassian that is working on project configuration for [next-gen projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/working-with-next-gen-software-projects-945104895.html].

We have been recently receiving Next-gen feedback with requests for versions and components. I just wanted to provide an update that in the near future we will be looking at these features and how we can improve them before bringing them to Next-gen projects. I will update this ticket when we start that body of work.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or feedback.

Regards,  
Nathan Sturgess
nsturgess@atlassian.com 
Product Manager, JIRA Platform

{panel}

*Original feature request:*

The on the fly creation makes it too easy to create unwanted items. This is especially true for components, which are typically created only rarely, so the extra steps are not a problem. An option to disable this feature would be very welcome.

The same sentiment is expressed in https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/317066/prevent-on-the-fly-component-creation
fields.summary: Allow disabling "on the fly" creation of new components and/or versions
Update bamboo templates prefix for 6.3

Hi,

I am Atlassian Verified vendor and developer of a couple of JIRA add-ons.
I am facing a strange error which bothers me and some of my customers more than a year. A customer raised a [support ticket|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/REL-6], and finally they told me to raise an issue here indicating the reproducing steps.

Customers are getting below exception when two plugins installed at the same time.
{code}
Caused by: org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.config.StatusManager] is defined: Unsatisfied dependency of type [interface com.atlassian.jira.config.StatusManager]: expected at least 1 matching bean
{code}

Here are the steps to reproduce problem :
- Install JIRA
- Install plugin  [Issue Alternative Assignee|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.iamhuy.jira.plugin.issue-alternative-assignee]
- Install plugin [Time to SLA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/plugin.tts]
- Reboot JIRA
- Create custom field "Overdue Status" which comes with Time to SLA
- Go to configuration page of custom field (click actions icon, then select Configure in custom fields listing)
- Click "Edit Including SLAs" link, Ooops 404, and the stack trace is attached at the bottom of this issue.

Finally I found the root cause of the issue. Both plugins has class named {{EditConfiguration}} and they are both extending {{AbstractEditConfigurationItemAction}}

{code}
class EditConfiguration extends AbstractEditConfigurationItemAction {
 ...
}
{code}

When I change the class name to be any value except {{EditConfiguration}} it works.

As a work around I'm gonna change all class names, but I think it will be great to fix this problem in JIRA API because all tutorials are telling to use {{EditConfiguration}} class name :)

Here is the whole stack trace:
{code}

fields.summary: Plugin incompatibility occurs when both plugins use same class name (extending AbstractEditConfigurationItemAction)
Upgrade JIRA Suite Utilities to 1.4.10 in Cloud
Provide release status of Affects/FixVersion on issue screen
Better Handling of Duplicate GUIDS During LDAP Sync

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42056].
  {panel}

It seems that it is currently not possible to update a  custom field (in this case a check box field) with multiple choices. 

Let's say for example a check box field has 2 choices; First and Second. The Post Function is only capable of updating the field to either First or Second; not both. Using 2 Post Function will only result in the later overwriting the value of the first Post Function. 

When you attempt to update the field with the value 'First, Second' (this is the value shown on the issue view screen if both check boxes are ticked); the  transition fails.

It will be nice if the post function is capable of updating the check box field (or any other fields with similar characteristics) with multiple values instead of only 1.
fields.summary: Post Function Update Custom Field should be capable of updating checkboxes with multiple choices
Generate a Report via Project Category
Highlight new comments since the user's last visited session on an issue

fields.description:
Hello, I am experiencing the same issues as part of this ticket. I am trying to create a filter and some of the custom fields are not available even if I don't select any project (or select the correct one) and all settings seems to be done correctly. 

Do you have any advice what could be a reason and how to resolve this? 

Thank you,
Miiroslav

Transitions - set field to current week of year
Preference key unclear
As a JIRA Application Administrator, I would like to be able to configure the information sent via Webhooks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42044].
  {panel}

Order of events:
# mail handler 1 starts processing a message with attachments; log: {code}Issue XX-1234 created{code}
# mail handler 2 starts processing the same message and MailFetcherService's getAssociatedIssueKey detects existing issue with the Message-ID; log: {code}Deleting message 'foo' without processing in order to avoid creating duplicate issues/comments. This message has already been partially processed, associated issue key: XX-1234{code}
# mail handler 1 tries to process attachment; log: {code}Exception while adding attachments to XX-1234. Some attachments from the message might be missing. Making a note on the issue.
java.io.IOException

        at javax.activation.DataSourceDataContentHandler.getContent(DataHandler.java:797)
        at javax.activation.DataHandler.getContent(DataHandler.java:542)
        at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.getContent(MimeBodyPart.java:637)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42037].
  {panel}

Issue key has been used to communicate about issue's progress and status. And at the moment, subtasks issue type and parent issue type follow the same pattern of issue key. 

It would be useful if Subtask sequence number could be added as JIRA field, so it will be filterable in issue navigator. This will ease the user to refer to the subtask. Perhaps using the combination of (parent issuekey)-(subtask sequence number)
(i)Sequence number refers to the sequence number of subtask shown in the parent issue.

The following could be useful if implemented:
# save the sequence number of a sub-task as a JIRA field so that this can be displayed as a column. OR
# allow searching and quick search for sub-tasks with the syntax (parent issuekey)-(sequence number)
fields.summary: Adding Subtask sequence number as JIRA field to be filterable in Issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42036].
  {panel}

When transit an issue to another state, we refer to the following transition ID found in the GET method JSON.

For example:
# GET http://localhost:8080/rest/api/latest/issue/TEST-1/transitions
# The request returns the states 'Resolved' => '5', 'Closed' => '6', 'In Progress' => '3'. 
# POST http://localhost:8080/rest/api/latest/issue/TEST-1/transitions
{code}
{"transition":{"id":"7"}}
{code}
# This time with JSON data {"transition":{"id":"7"}} and get the '500 Internal Server Error' because transition ID = 7 is not exist.
{code}
2015-01-21 17:54:29,343 http-bio-8080-exec-20 ERROR admin 1134x2089x1 xxxx xx.xx.xx.xx /rest/api/latest/issue/TEST-1/transitions [jira.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in response
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowActionsBean.getFieldScreenForView(WorkflowActionsBean.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.getScreenFromAction(StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.java:130)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.createFieldScreenRenderer(StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.FieldScreenRendererFactoryImpl.getFieldScreenRenderer(FieldScreenRendererFactoryImpl.java:55)
{code}

The NPE error is misleading to user and it would be great if JIRA can handle the error by showing a meaningful error message. Besides being misleading it seems to indicate that there is a bug in the error handling routines, and IMHO should be fixed.
fields.summary: JIRA REST API returned a NPE error if stated wrong transition ID

  {panel}

Customer requirement:

Right now we have multiple git repositories in our Stash and each repo is a part of one module of of a bigger application which will go as a single Application when we release.

In Jira we are maintaining one Single Project and in that we have various components for each module(git repository) and each component can be released separately and can be of different version than the Full Application also different components can be part of the Full Application.

So it will be easy to maintain the life cycle of the modules which are in different repos if we can link Components to different repos.
fields.summary: Link Stash project to a JIRA component's

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42013].
  {panel}

Although the following documentation mention MySQL to be supported, the two most common flavors of MySQL are not specifically listed as ones that likely will cause issues.
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+MySQL

MariaDB and Percona are proven to cause problems with JIRA and we have open feature requests to support those (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42012, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-32347), but since the documentation do not specifically mention they are not supported, in many cases users will make the assumption they are okay to use.
fields.summary: Documentation request: mention not supported flavors of MySQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42009].
  {panel}

Hi again.

I would like to suggest a way a user can use one selected Head and one selected Feet from a list, as for having them always in all our communications to others. What I mean to suggest is, while writing either on a comment textbox or a description textbox, that my preferenced HEAD and FEET appears without having to write it by the user. 

Some Heads a user check as preferenced may be:
- Morning,
- Good morning,
- Hi there,
- Hi,
- To whom it may concerns,

And some Foot a user as preferenced may be:
- Regards + my first name.
- Best regards + my first name.

So, when a writer needs to communicate something he goes directly to what he wants to say. And the reader will just receive the communication in good mood.

What do you think guys?
PS: Both Heads and Feet should be written in accordance to user language.
fields.summary: Morning and Regards

I would like to suggest you guys Jira to have Desktop Notifications as for me to do not be updating constantly Jira to watch if something new has come, stopping what I am working on... just to see if something came on. 

It will help us users.

Thank you.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42007].
  {panel}

h4. Background
If a customer send an email to create issue or add a comment to an issue, sometimes JIRA failed to process the email, maybe due to the Permission or even the configuration itself. At the moment, JIRA did not inform the sender that the sent email failed to be added into JIRA.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create Incoming Mail Handler for *Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue* in JIRA
# Do not (/) the *Create User* option, and leave *Default Assignee* empty
# Fill in the *Forward Email* field, so that any failed email will be notified to the Forward Email account
# Send an email to the Mail Handler

h4. Expected result
Both *Forward Email* and email sender are notified by JIRA

h4. Actual result
Only *Forward Email* account is notified of the problem
fields.summary: Send a reply email back to sender if JIRA could not process it

Some nice to haves would be:

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42002].
  {panel}

Hello,

As a JIRA user
I would like to filter by aggregatetimespent
So that I can provide answers like "list the tasks that took over two days to get resolved including all subtasks"

There is a column named "Σ Time Spent" which shows up the calculated "aggregatetimespent" however in order to filter by it a user would need to export and post-process the data.

The only alternative to this would be to prohibit time logging in subtasks. 

Thanks in advance,
- Nestor
fields.summary: Add Σ Time Spent (calculated aggregatetimespent) to filtering options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41977].
  {panel}

When editing a notification scheme, its quick to grant Users / Groups / Project Roles access to any or all available notification events via the Add link under Operations.

However, reversing that process isn't a trivial process.  

As admin, I want to delete all the default Notifications (Current Assignee, Reporter, All Watchers) for:

Issue Reopened (System)	
Issue Deleted (System)	
Issue Moved (System)	
Work Logged On Issue (System)	
Work Started On Issue (System)	
Work Stopped On Issue (System)	
Issue Worklog Updated (System)	
Issue Worklog Deleted (System)	
Generic Event (System)	

To do that I'm required to Delete/Confirm 27 times, which is a tedious process and consumes productivity. 

Ideally we could streamline deleting notification events by providing admins with the ability to bulk delete.
fields.summary: Bulk Delete Notification Scheme
